analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la so sor rtog pa ni so sor brtags pa ste /
translated: The meaning is that the investigation of the individual aspects of the truths of suffering, etc., is the individual investigation of each of the truths.

original: shes rab kyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning is that it is a special wisdom.

original: so sor ma brtags pa ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pa ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Non-investigation is non-individual investigation.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rkyen ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen ma tshang ba'o //
translated: It is the incompleteness of conditions.

original: de ni 'di skad du rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams gtan du mi skye ba gang yin pa de so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams gtan du mi skye ba gang yin pa de so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning is that it is the non-arising of future dharmas due to the incompleteness of conditions.

original: gang 'gog pa la 'bral ba ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dri ba'i lan no //
analyzed: gang 'gog pa la 'bral ba ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dri ba'i lan no //
translated: The answer to the question is: ‚ÄúThat cessation which is not separation, etc.‚Äù

original: 'gog pa zhes byas na ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa bzhin du so sor brtags pa dang ; snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba dang / mi rtag pa'i 'gog pa rnams la yang snyegs pas 'dir so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa rnam par dbye ba'i phyir 'bral ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes byas na ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa bzhin du so sor brtags pa dang ; snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba dang / mi rtag pa'i 'gog pa rnams la yang snyegs pas 'dir so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa rnam par dbye ba'i phyir 'bral ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, in order to classify analytical cessation, nonseparation is mentioned.

original: 'bral ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni sa bon yod na de dag 'byung ba'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams dang phrad par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'bral ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni sa bon yod na de dag 'byung ba'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams dang phrad par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Nonseparation is posited as contact with future states because it is the nature of those states to arise when their seeds exist.

original: de'i gnyen pos rang gi gnas nas de dag gi sa bon bton bzhin gtan mi skye ba gang yin pa de 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen pos rang gi gnas nas de dag gi sa bon bton bzhin gtan mi skye ba gang yin pa de 'gog pa'o //
translated: That which is the complete nonarising of those states through the removal of their seeds from their place by their antidote is cessation.

original: de ni 'di skad du sa bon bton la blo sngon du ma btang yang rkyen ma tshang bas ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams @242a * //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du sa bon bton la blo sngon du ma btang yang rkyen ma tshang bas ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams @242a * //
translated: This is stated in this way: When the seeds are removed, future states are posited as contact through the incompleteness of conditions, even though the mind does not anticipate them.

original: gtan mi skye ba gang yin pa de so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan mi skye ba gang yin pa de so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is never produced is nonanalytical cessation.

original: dgra bcom pa la ni ris gzhan dang 'brel ba'i dge ba dang / lung dum bstan pa'i phung po rnams kyis bon yod bzhin du gtan mi skye ba thob pas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la ni ris gzhan dang 'brel ba'i dge ba dang / lung dum bstan pa'i phung po rnams kyis bon yod bzhin du gtan mi skye ba thob pas /
translated: Since the arhat obtains the state of never being produced by virtue of the existence of the seeds of virtuous and neutral aggregates related to other lineages,

original: de yang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: that is nonanalytical cessation.üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / de ni gang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po med par phung po rnams gtan du mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ni gang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po med par phung po rnams gtan du mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: That which is never produced by the aggregates without the antidote to affliction.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is stated as follows:

original: 'di la dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i phung po'i sa bon yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'di la dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i phung po'i sa bon yod du zin kyang /
translated: Even though the seeds of virtuous and neutral aggregates exist,üîΩthey are not obtained without the antidote to affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po med par mi thob pas so so brtags pa'i 'gog pa nyid de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po med par mi thob pas so so brtags pa'i 'gog pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore they are analytical cessations.

original: 'di ni so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not nonanalytical cessation.

original: de ltar na phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the realm of nirvana with and without remainder is taught to be analytical cessation.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni 'dir zag pa med pa'i lam du bzhed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni 'dir zag pa med pa'i lam du bzhed do //
translated: The antidote to the afflictions is accepted here as the uncontaminated path.üîΩNonarising is permanent nonarising.

original: gtan du mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba la gtan du smos pa ni skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'gog pa las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan du mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba la gtan du smos pa ni skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'gog pa las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term permanent is mentioned in order to distinguish this from the cessation of birth and the cessation of meditative attainment.

original: de dag mi skye ba yin la gtan du ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dag mi skye ba yin la gtan du ma yin pa ste /
translated: Those are nonarising but not permanent,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because mind and mental factors can still occur.

original: mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa las rnam par 'byed de /
analyzed: mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa las rnam par 'byed de /
translated: Nonarising is distinguished from the cessation of impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa ni de ltar yod la mi skye ba ni da ltar med pas ma 'ongs pa yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa ni de ltar yod la mi skye ba ni da ltar med pas ma 'ongs pa yin pa nyid de /
translated: The cessation of impermanence exists in the present, but nonarising is the future because it does not exist in the present.

original: dper na gzugs kyi rnam pa gcig la mig gi rnam par shes pa yengs pa yul gzhan dang / gzugs kyi rnam pa gzhan 'das pa gang yin pa de dag ni dmigs pa de'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga bskyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyi rnam pa gcig la mig gi rnam par shes pa yengs pa yul gzhan dang / gzugs kyi rnam pa gzhan 'das pa gang yin pa de dag ni dmigs pa de'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga bskyed par mi nus te /
translated: For example, the eye consciousness that is distracted by another object and the form that has passed are not able to generate the five collections of consciousness that have that as their object.

original: da ltar gyi rnam pa la ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen med cing /
analyzed: da ltar gyi rnam pa la ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen med cing /
translated: Because the present form does not have the condition as the equivalent and immediately antecedent,

original: 'das pa rnams la ni dmigs pa'i rkyen med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa rnams la ni dmigs pa'i rkyen med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the past forms do not have the object condition.

original: de'i phyir de dag la so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they are the non-analytical cessation.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is cessation due to deliberation?

original: so sor rtog pa ni so sor brtags pa ste /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa ni so sor brtags pa ste /
translated: Deliberation is deliberation.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis shes rab kyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis shes rab kyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the distinctive wisdom of the uninterrupted path.

original: so sor brtags pas thob par bya ba'i 'gog @242b pa ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas thob par bya ba'i 'gog @242b pa ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa ste /
translated: Cessation that is to be attained by deliberation is cessation due to deliberation.

original: tshig bar ma ma smos so //
analyzed: tshig bar ma ma smos so //
translated: The middle word is omitted.

original: gang 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa thams cad du thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gang 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa thams cad du thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is called cessation‚Äù is stated because it would follow that all cessations would be the truth of the path.

original: de ni 'brel pa ste zhes bya ba smos so /
analyzed: de ni 'brel pa ste zhes bya ba smos so /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is related to‚Äù is stated.

original: de ltar na 'gog pa lhag ma bzhi po las rnam par phye ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'gog pa lhag ma bzhi po las rnam par phye ba yin te /
translated: Thus, it is distinguished from the remaining four types of cessation.

original: de dag ni 'bral ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni 'bral ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not characterized by separation.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos phung po gtan du mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'bral ba nyid dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos phung po gtan du mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'bral ba nyid dpyod pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is the nonarising of the aggregates due to the antidote to the afflictions‚Äù is an analysis of separation.

original: lus 'di ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon nam lus pa dang / rjes su 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon nam lus pa dang / rjes su 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: This body is related to the remaining seeds of the afflictions of the three realms.

original: de la gang dang gang gi gnyen po lam gyi skad cig gang dang gang yin pa'i lam de 'byung na lus kyi skad cig de ni des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa'i phyi ma lus kyi skad cig gzhan 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: de la gang dang gang gi gnyen po lam gyi skad cig gang dang gang yin pa'i lam de 'byung na lus kyi skad cig de ni des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa'i phyi ma lus kyi skad cig gzhan 'byung ba dang /
translated: When the path that is the antidote to a particular affliction arises, the body that is the basis of the path is not related to the seeds of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by that path.

original: mi mthun pa'i rkyen du gyur pa dang / phyi ma lus kyi skad cig gzhan skyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i rkyen du gyur pa dang / phyi ma lus kyi skad cig gzhan skyed par mi nus te /
translated: and it is not a condition that is incompatible with the arising of another moment of body in the future.

original: de 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i rkyen nye bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i rkyen nye bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a condition that is compatible with its arising.

original: 'on kyang des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon ldog pa bdag nyid kho na'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon ldog pa bdag nyid kho na'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: However, it is the cause of the cessation of the seed of the affliction that is to be abandoned by it,

original: de byung ba dang mthun pa'i rkyen yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de byung ba dang mthun pa'i rkyen yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a condition that is compatible with its arising.

original: lam gyi skad cig de nyid ni des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa'i skad cig gzhan 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i rkyen du gyur pa dang / cig shos dang mthun par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lam gyi skad cig de nyid ni des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa'i skad cig gzhan 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i rkyen du gyur pa dang / cig shos dang mthun par brjod par bya'o //
translated: That very moment of the path is said to be a condition that is incompatible with the arising of another moment that possesses the seed of the affliction that is to be abandoned by it, and it is said to be compatible with the other.

original: de bzhin du bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa chung du chung ngu'i bar gyi gnyen po byung na lus de khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i sa bon ma lus par ldog pa'i bdag nyid kho na'i skad cig gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa chung du chung ngu'i bar gyi gnyen po byung na lus de khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i sa bon ma lus par ldog pa'i bdag nyid kho na'i skad cig gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, when the antidote to the afflictions of the summit of existence, which are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, arises, it becomes the cause of another moment that is the very nature of the complete cessation of the seeds of the afflictions of the three realms to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa gang dang gang gi lus mi 'byung bas sa bon bton par gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos gtan du mi skye bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa gang dang gang gi lus mi 'byung bas sa bon bton par gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pos gtan du mi skye bar 'byung ste /
translated: Likewise, when the seeds of any affliction are extracted by the body of any affliction not arising, the phenomena concomitant with those afflictions also arise as never to occur again through the antidote to the afflictions.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa de ni 'bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa de ni 'bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This cessation through analysis is called separation.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'i 'og tu de bzhin nyid bstan pas de'i phyir de bshad pa'i 'og tu de bzhin nyid khong du chud par 'dod nas /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'i 'og tu de bzhin nyid bstan pas de'i phyir de bshad pa'i 'og tu de bzhin nyid khong du chud par 'dod nas /
translated: After cessation through analysis, suchness is taught. Therefore, after explaining that, in order to understand suchness, it is said:üîΩThe suchness of the world should be known.

original: de bzhin nyid gang zhe na zhes 'dri'o //üîΩgang chos rnams kyi chos @243a * //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang zhe na zhes 'dri'o // gang chos rnams kyi chos @243a * //
translated: What is thusness?üîΩThe reality of phenomena and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: nyid dang chos bdag med pa nyid do zhes bya ba de ni de'i bshad pa ste /
analyzed: nyid dang chos bdag med pa nyid do zhes bya ba de ni de'i bshad pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of that.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i don gyi phyir de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i don gyi phyir de bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is thusness because it is the meaning that is not other.

original: chos rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The phenomena are form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: chos rnams kyi dngos bo ni chos nyid de ji lta ba bzhin gyi bdag nyid dang yang dag pa'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi dngos bo ni chos nyid de ji lta ba bzhin gyi bdag nyid dang yang dag pa'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The reality of phenomena is the nature of phenomena, the nature that is just as it is, and the ultimate truth.

original: chos nyid ni chos rnams kyi 'bras bu mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa yang chos rnams la yod de /
analyzed: chos nyid ni chos rnams kyi 'bras bu mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa yang chos rnams la yod de /
translated: The reality of phenomena is also impermanence and so on, the result of phenomena.

original: de'i phyir chos bdag med pa nyid ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos bdag med pa nyid ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the selflessness of phenomena.

original: chos ni rang bzhin gang gis shes pa dang / brjod pa gnyis kyi yul du 'gyur ba de de dag gi bdag ste /
analyzed: chos ni rang bzhin gang gis shes pa dang / brjod pa gnyis kyi yul du 'gyur ba de de dag gi bdag ste /
translated: A phenomenon is that which becomes the object of both knowledge and expression by virtue of its intrinsic nature. That is its self.

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir bdag de dang bral ba ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir bdag de dang bral ba ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: Since it is not its nature, being free from that self is selflessness.

original: de'i dngos po ni bdag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni bdag med pa nyid do //
translated: Its reality is selflessness.

original: de ni dngos po rnams rnam par brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni dngos po rnams rnam par brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: That is the emptiness of the imagined nature of things.

original: 'di la dpyad na brjod pa mang du 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di la dpyad na brjod pa mang du 'byung ste /
translated: If this is analyzed, many statements occur.

original: de thal bar 'gyur bas kyang chog gi skabs nyid brtsam mo //
analyzed: de thal bar 'gyur bas kyang chog gi skabs nyid brtsam mo //
translated: Since that would lead to too many words, I will just begin the topic.

original: ci'i phyir skye mched ces bya zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skye mched ces bya zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Why are they called sense bases?

original: skye mched kyi sgra ni mig la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo phan tshun tha dad pa rnams la yang bye brag med par 'byung bas de'i phyir de dag la des spyi'i don rgyur byas nas 'jug go //
analyzed: skye mched kyi sgra ni mig la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo phan tshun tha dad pa rnams la yang bye brag med par 'byung bas de'i phyir de dag la des spyi'i don rgyur byas nas 'jug go //
translated: The term sense base occurs without distinction even for the eye, etc., which have different individual natures. Therefore, it engages them in general, taking their meaning as a cause.

original: de yang mi shes pas ci'i phyir skye mched ces bya zhes 'dri'o //
analyzed: de yang mi shes pas ci'i phyir skye mched ces bya zhes 'dri'o //
translated: Since that is not understood, he asks, ‚ÄúWhy are they called sense bases?‚Äù

original: rnam par shes ba skye ba'i sgo'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par shes ba skye ba'i sgo'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are doors for the arising of consciousness.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba ste /
translated: Arising is occurrence.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung bas bdag nyid thob pa'o //üîΩrnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung bas bdag nyid thob pa'o // rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo ni rgyu ste /
translated: The sense faculties are the basis of the arising of consciousness, because they are the support of the arising of consciousness.üîΩThe sense bases are the door of arising of consciousness, because they are the cause of the arising of consciousness.

original: byed rgyu dang rgyu mtshan ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo'o //
analyzed: byed rgyu dang rgyu mtshan ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo'o //
translated: The efficient cause and the causal sign are the door of arising of consciousness.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir skye mched rnams zhes bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir skye mched rnams zhes bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The sense bases are so called because they are the cause of the arising of consciousness.

original: 'di ltar ci mngon zhe na nges pa'i tshig gis mngon te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci mngon zhe na nges pa'i tshig gis mngon te /
translated: How is this understood? It is understood from the etymological explanation.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi 'byung ba mched par byed cing rgyas par byed pas skye mched rnams te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi 'byung ba mched par byed cing rgyas par byed pas skye mched rnams te /
translated: The sense bases are so called because they cause the arising of mind and mental factors, because they cause their appearance, and because they cause their growth.

original: bdag thob par byed pa rgyun du 'jog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag thob par byed pa rgyun du 'jog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are the support of the arising of consciousness.

original: de la mig dang gzugs rnams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa skye ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: de la mig dang gzugs rnams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa skye ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: In this regard, the eye and visible form are the door of the arising of the eye consciousness together with its associated factors.

original: de bzhin du yid dang chos rnams kyi bar dag kyang yid kyi rnam par @243b shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i skye ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid dang chos rnams kyi bar dag kyang yid kyi rnam par @243b shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i skye ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: Likewise, the mental faculty and mental objects are the gateway for the arising of mental consciousness together with its associated mental factors.

original: skye mched kyi 'og tu khams rnams rab tu dbye ba dang / rang gi ngo bo brjod bar bya ste /
analyzed: skye mched kyi 'og tu khams rnams rab tu dbye ba dang / rang gi ngo bo brjod bar bya ste /
translated: After the bases, the elements should be differentiated and their individual natures stated.

original: de bas na rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate their differentiation,

original: khams bco brgyad ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúThe eighteen elements.‚Äù

original: de dag nyid kyi rang rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi rang rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate their individual natures,

original: mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang zhes bya ba'i bar du smos so //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang zhes bya ba'i bar du smos so //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúThe eye element, the form element, the eye consciousness element, and so on, up to the mind element, the entity element, and the mind consciousness element.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang gzugs kyi phung po rnam par dbye ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po gang yin pa lnga po dag dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa lnga yang de dag gi yul nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir yang gzugs kyi phung po rnam par dbye ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po gang yin pa lnga po dag dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa lnga yang de dag gi yul nyid du bstan to //
translated: Here, the analysis of the form heap is the five faculties of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body, and the five objects of form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: skye mched rnam par gzhag par yang dbang po lnga po de dag nyid mig la sogs pa'i skye mched nyid dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched nyid bstan to //
analyzed: skye mched rnam par gzhag par yang dbang po lnga po de dag nyid mig la sogs pa'i skye mched nyid dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched nyid bstan to //
translated: In the presentation of the sense bases, those same five faculties are the sense bases of the eye, etc., and the objects of form, etc., are the sense bases of form, etc.

original: khams rnam par gzhag pa yang de dag nyid mig gi khams nas lus kyi khams kyi bar dang / gzugs kyi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du bstan te /
analyzed: khams rnam par gzhag pa yang de dag nyid mig gi khams nas lus kyi khams kyi bar dang / gzugs kyi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du bstan te /
translated: In the presentation of the elements, those same faculties are the eye element and the form element up to the body element and the tactility element.

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i khams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i khams ni skye mched rnams ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i khams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i khams ni skye mched rnams ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the elements of the eye, etc., and the elements of form, etc., are the same as the sense bases.

original: chos kyi khams ni chos kyi skye mched tshor ba la sogs pa phung po gsum dang / rnam bar rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa zhi gang yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi khams ni chos kyi skye mched tshor ba la sogs pa phung po gsum dang / rnam bar rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa zhi gang yin pa nyid do //
translated: The element of mental objects is the same as the sense-source of mental objects, which is the three aggregates of feeling, etc., non-informative form, and the unconditioned.

original: skye mched rnam par gzhag pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po nyid yid kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: skye mched rnam par gzhag pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po nyid yid kyi skye mched do //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness, as it is presented in the presentation of the sense-sources, is the sense-source of the mental faculty.

original: de bzhin du khams rnam par gzhag par yang yid kyi skye mched nyid kyi khams ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnam par gzhag par yang yid kyi skye mched nyid kyi khams ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, in the presentation of the elements, the sense-source of the mental faculty is not the element of the mental faculty.

original: yid kyi skye mched kyi khams rnam par gzhag pa na /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched kyi khams rnam par gzhag pa na /
translated: When the element of the mental faculty is presented,

original: sems kye khams bdun no //
analyzed: sems kye khams bdun no //
translated: the element of the mental faculty is the seven consciousness elements.

original: de'i phyir / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe six consciousness elements are the mind sense-source.‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa la brten te zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang yid la brten te'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la brten te zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang yid la brten te'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDependent on the eye, etc.‚Äù means dependent on the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa zhes @244a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa zhes @244a * //
translated: ‚ÄúWith form, etc., as their objects‚Äù means

original: bya ba ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: The objects are form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects.

original: rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the six collections of consciousness.

original: de la mig la brten cing gzugs la dmigs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la mig la brten cing gzugs la dmigs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //üîΩde bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la brten cing /üîΩsgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos rnams la go rims bzhin du dmigs pa ni rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams te ;
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams so // de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la brten cing / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos rnams la go rims bzhin du dmigs pa ni rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams te ;
translated: The eye consciousness is the eye consciousness element.üîΩSimilarly, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind consciousnesses arise in dependence on the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind, and in dependence on sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: The ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind consciousnesses are the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind consciousness elements.

original: yid kyi khams ni rnam par shes pa drug las gud na med de /
analyzed: yid kyi khams ni rnam par shes pa drug las gud na med de /
translated: The thinking mind element is not separate from the six consciousnesses.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po de dag nyid 'gag sam thog pa la yid kyi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po de dag nyid 'gag sam thog pa la yid kyi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: The cessation or stopping of these six elements of consciousness is called the mental element.

original: de ltar na yid kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po dag gcig gi nang du gcig 'dus pa'i phyir khams bcu bdun nam bcu gnyis su mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de ltar na yid kyi khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po dag gcig gi nang du gcig 'dus pa'i phyir khams bcu bdun nam bcu gnyis su mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Thus, since the mental element and the six elements of consciousness are included in one another, should the elements not number seventeen or twelve?

original: mi 'gyur te 'di ltar rnam par shes pa drug pa'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te 'di ltar rnam par shes pa drug pa'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: They should not, because the eighteen elements are posited in order to demonstrate the basis of the six consciousnesses.

original: de ltar khams bco brgyad du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar khams bco brgyad du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the elements are established as eighteen.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus means as previously explained.

original: gzugs kyi phung po gang yin pa zhes bya ba la rdzas bcu gcig ni gzugs kyi phung po bstan te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po gang yin pa zhes bya ba la rdzas bcu gcig ni gzugs kyi phung po bstan te /
translated: The aggregate of form is taught as eleven substances.

original: de la mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga ni skye mched rnam par gzhag par skye mched bcu dang ; khams rnam par gzhag par khams bcu dang / chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga ni skye mched rnam par gzhag par skye mched bcu dang ; khams rnam par gzhag par khams bcu dang / chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs gcig dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The five sense faculties, such as the eye, and the five sense objects, such as form, are the ten bases in the presentation of the bases, the ten elements in the presentation of the elements, and one part of the sense base of mental objects and one part of the element of mental objects, which is called nonindicative form.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang yin pa de ni yid kyi skye mched dang / sems kyi khams bdun no zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi khams kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang yin pa de ni yid kyi skye mched dang / sems kyi khams bdun no zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi khams kyi bar du'o //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the sense base of the mental faculty and the seven elements of consciousness, from the element of eye consciousness to the element of mind.

original: gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po las gzhan phung po gsum gang yin pa dag tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed ces bya ba'i phung po rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po las gzhan phung po gsum gang yin pa dag tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed ces bya ba'i phung po rnams so //
translated: The three aggregates that are different from the form aggregate and the consciousness aggregate are called the aggregates of feeling, perception, and formation.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs @244b gcig ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs @244b gcig ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: One part of the form aggregate is called nonindicative form.

original: de dag 'dus ma byas nam mkha' la sogs pa dang / bcas pa ni chos kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: de dag 'dus ma byas nam mkha' la sogs pa dang / bcas pa ni chos kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams so //
translated: The unconditioned factors, i.e., space, etc., and the cessation not due to deliberation are the sense-sphere of factors and the element of factors.

original: ci'i phyir khams zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khams zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Why is it called element?

original: skye mched bzhin du rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched bzhin du rgya cher brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be explained in the same way as the sense-sphere.

original: byed pa med la rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir khams so //
analyzed: byed pa med la rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir khams so //
translated: It is called element because it is the receptacle of the specific characteristics.

original: skad cig rnams la ni byed pa med par mi srid do zhes sngar bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: skad cig rnams la ni byed pa med par mi srid do zhes sngar bstan pa nyid do //
translated: It has been shown above that the specific characteristics are not possible without activity.

original: chos gang dag phung po zhes bstan pa de dag nyid skye mched nyid dang / khams nyid du yang bshad pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: chos gang dag phung po zhes bstan pa de dag nyid skye mched nyid dang / khams nyid du yang bshad pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since the aggregates, sense-spheres and elements have been explained in this way,

original: ci'i phyir phung po la sogs pa bshad ce na zhes dris so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po la sogs pa bshad ce na zhes dris so //
translated: why are they explained again?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bshad pa thams cad ni sems can gyi don du 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pas dgos pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bshad pa thams cad ni sems can gyi don du 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pas dgos pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the aggregates, etc., by the Lord is not without purpose, for it is for the benefit of sentient beings and is an antidote to the afflictions.

original: 'dir ni chos de dag nyid rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis yang dang yang bshad pa'i dgos pa yang mi shes nas /
analyzed: 'dir ni chos de dag nyid rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis yang dang yang bshad pa'i dgos pa yang mi shes nas /
translated: Here, one does not understand the purpose of explaining those same phenomena again and again with different aspects.

original: ci'i phyir phung po la sogs pa bshad ce na zhes bya ba ni dgos pa brjod do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po la sogs pa bshad ce na zhes bya ba ni dgos pa brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said, For what purpose are the aggregates, etc. explained?

original: de'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen por zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen por zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, As antidotes to the three types of self-grasping.

original: de la bdag tu 'dzin pa gsum dang / gang gi gnyen por bshad pa yang mi shes pas de'i phyir go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la bdag tu 'dzin pa gsum dang / gang gi gnyen por bshad pa yang mi shes pas de'i phyir go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since one does not understand the three types of self-grasping and what they are antidotes to, it is said, respectively.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum ni gcig pur 'dzin pa dang / za bar 'dzin pa dang / byed par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum ni gcig pur 'dzin pa dang / za bar 'dzin pa dang / byed par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The three types of self-grasping are grasping as unitary, grasping as an experiencer, and grasping as an agent.

original: de la go rims bzhin zhes bya ba la phung po bshad pa ni gcig pur 'dzin pa'i gnyen po'o //üîΩskye mched bshad pa ni za bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de la go rims bzhin zhes bya ba la phung po bshad pa ni gcig pur 'dzin pa'i gnyen po'o // skye mched bshad pa ni za bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: There, it is said, respectively. The explanation of the aggregates is the antidote to grasping as unitary.üîΩThe explanation of the sense bases is the antidote to grasping as an experiencer.

original: khams bshad pa ni byed par 'dzin pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: khams bshad pa ni byed par 'dzin pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The explanation of the elements is the antidote to grasping as an agent.

original: bdag tu smra ba thams cad ni mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid thos pa dang / snom pa dang / ro myong ba dang / reg pa yin pa dang / de la de nyid sems par byed ba dang / 'du shes su byed pa dang /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba thams cad ni mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid thos pa dang / snom pa dang / ro myong ba dang / reg pa yin pa dang / de la de nyid sems par byed ba dang / 'du shes su byed pa dang /
translated: All the proponents of a self think that what sees is also what hears, smells, tastes, touches, and cognizes.

original: rnam par shes par byed pa'o snyam du de ltar 'dzin to //
analyzed: rnam par shes par byed pa'o snyam du de ltar 'dzin to //
translated: They think that the self is what thinks, what perceives, and what cognizes.

original: sems can rnams kyi lus la ni phung po lnga las gud na gcig pur rnam par gnas pa'i ngo bo gang yang med de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lus la ni phung po lnga las gud na gcig pur rnam par gnas pa'i ngo bo gang yang med de /
translated: There is no self that is separate from the five aggregates and that exists as a single thing.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang / 'bras bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmig las gud na lta ba po @245a * //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang / 'bras bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro // mig las gud na lta ba po @245a * //
translated: This is because its own nature and its effects cannot be perceived.

original: gzhan med de /
analyzed: gzhan med de /
translated: There is no seer that is separate from the eye.üîΩThe eye itself sees.

original: mig nyid mthong ba'o zhes rnam par shes pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu dang gnas yin pas lta ba po zhes gdags so //
analyzed: mig nyid mthong ba'o zhes rnam par shes pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu dang gnas yin pas lta ba po zhes gdags so //
translated: The eye is designated as the seer because it is the uncommon cause and the basis of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa so so la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa so so la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for each of the other faculties, such as the ear.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba ni myong ba'i bdag nyid yin pas myong bar byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba ni myong ba'i bdag nyid yin pas myong bar byed /
translated: Likewise, feeling is the nature of experience, so it is what experiences.

original: 'du shes nyid mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid yin pas 'du shes su byed kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'du shes nyid mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid yin pas 'du shes su byed kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Discrimination is the nature of apprehending signs, so it is what discriminates.

original: de ltar thams cad du yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad du yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for all the other aggregates.

original: de lta bas na sems can rnams kyi lus ni phung po'i bdag nyid yin pas dngos po du ma'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems can rnams kyi lus ni phung po'i bdag nyid yin pas dngos po du ma'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Thus, since the bodies of sentient beings are the nature of the aggregates, they are the nature of many things.

original: 'di la ni phung po lnga las gud na gcig pu med de /
analyzed: 'di la ni phung po lnga las gud na gcig pu med de /
translated: There is no single self apart from the five aggregates.

original: phung po bstan pas gcig pu 'dzin pa ldog pa na de la gcig pur 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa de yang ldog pa nyid de /
analyzed: phung po bstan pas gcig pu 'dzin pa ldog pa na de la gcig pur 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa de yang ldog pa nyid de /
translated: When the apprehension of a single self is stopped by teaching the aggregates, then the apprehension of a self that precedes the apprehension of a single self is also stopped.

original: de'i phyir gcig pur 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por phung po bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig pur 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por phung po bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates are taught as the antidote to the apprehension of a self that precedes the apprehension of a single self.

original: gcig pur 'dzin pa ni rgyu la 'bras bu btags nas bdag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: gcig pur 'dzin pa ni rgyu la 'bras bu btags nas bdag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: The apprehension of a single self is explained as the apprehension of a self that imputes the result to the cause.

original: za bar 'dzin pa ni smra ba thams cad ci ltar na las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas rab tu phye ba dang / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yul la gang sbyod pa de bdag go zhes so //
analyzed: za bar 'dzin pa ni smra ba thams cad ci ltar na las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas rab tu phye ba dang / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yul la gang sbyod pa de bdag go zhes so //
translated: The grasping of the experiencer is the thought: ‚ÄúI am the one who speaks, and I am the one who experiences all the objects such as form and sound, which are distinguished by the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, which are distinguished by the pleasant and unpleasant feelings of happiness and suffering.‚Äù

original: de ltar na bdag tu 'dzin pa 'di'i gnyen por skye mched bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag tu 'dzin pa 'di'i gnyen por skye mched bshad do //
translated: Thus, the bases are explained as the antidote to this grasping at self.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams la spyod pa ni dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams la spyod pa ni dmigs pa ste /
translated: The object is the experience of the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions and the experience of objects such as form.

original: de byed pa gang yin pa de ni las kyi 'bras bu dang / gzugs la sogs pa la spyod do //
analyzed: de byed pa gang yin pa de ni las kyi 'bras bu dang / gzugs la sogs pa la spyod do //
translated: The agent is the one who performs that experience of the results of actions and the experience of form and so on.

original: dmigs pa rnam pa drug de yang skye mched nyid kyis byed kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam pa drug de yang skye mched nyid kyis byed kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: That is the sixfold object, and it is the bases themselves that perform it, not anything else.

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo'i phyir skye mched rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo'i phyir skye mched rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the eyes, etc. and the visible forms, etc. are called the sense-fields because they are the doors for the arising of consciousness.

original: de lta bas na las kyi 'bras bu dang / yul rnams la spyod pa ni mig la sogs pa las gud na gzhan gang yang med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na las kyi 'bras bu dang / yul rnams la spyod pa ni mig la sogs pa las gud na gzhan gang yang med de /
translated: Thus, the one who experiences the results of action and the objects is none other than what is separate from the eyes, etc.

original: de ltar na skye mched bshad pa ni za bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na skye mched bshad pa ni za bar 'dzin pa'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the explanation of the sense-fields is the antidote to the apprehension of the experiencer.

original: byed par 'dzin pa ni @245b las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams 'brel ba dang / sprugs bsigs pa la sogs pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: byed par 'dzin pa ni @245b las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams 'brel ba dang / sprugs bsigs pa la sogs pa byed pa ste /
translated: The apprehension of the agent is the connection of virtuous and non-virtuous actions and the performance of churning, stirring, etc.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa 'di'i gnyen por khams bshad do //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa 'di'i gnyen por khams bshad do //
translated: The antidote to this apprehension of the self is the explanation of the elements.

original: de ltar na byed pa med la rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir khams zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na byed pa med la rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir khams zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is taught that the elements are so called because they perform no action but merely hold their own characteristics.

original: de ltar rgyu yod pa tsam gyis 'bras bu yang 'byung bar byed cing 'bras bu yang rgyu la ltos nas yod pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu yod pa tsam gyis 'bras bu yang 'byung bar byed cing 'bras bu yang rgyu la ltos nas yod pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Thus, the mere existence of the cause also produces the effect, and the effect also merely exists in dependence on the cause.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo las ma gtogs par byed pa gzhan med par sngar bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo las ma gtogs par byed pa gzhan med par sngar bstan pa nyid do //
translated: It has already been shown that apart from the nature of cause and effect, there is no other activity.

original: byed pa med par byed pa po ga la yod de /
analyzed: byed pa med par byed pa po ga la yod de /
translated: How can there be an agent without activity?

original: de lta bas na byed par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por khams bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na byed par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por khams bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the elements were taught as the antidote to the apprehension of activity.

original: de ni chos gang dag rab tu rnam par dbye bas phan gdags pa'i phyir phung po dang skye mched dang / khams nyid du chos gang dag bstan pa de dag la rnam pa gzhan gyis bsam par bya ste /üîΩde la khams rnams kyi nang du gzugs dang sems gnyis rnam par dbye ba lhag par bstan pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa bde blag tu rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir khams ga las brtsams te /
analyzed: de ni chos gang dag rab tu rnam par dbye bas phan gdags pa'i phyir phung po dang skye mched dang / khams nyid du chos gang dag bstan pa de dag la rnam pa gzhan gyis bsam par bya ste / de la khams rnams kyi nang du gzugs dang sems gnyis rnam par dbye ba lhag par bstan pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa bde blag tu rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir khams ga las brtsams te /
translated: Now, in order to benefit those who are to be trained by the classification of those phenomena, the aggregates, bases, and elements were taught. Those phenomena should be contemplated in another way.

original: bsam par bya ba'i phung po dang / skye mched rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam par bya ba'i phung po dang / skye mched rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: Among the elements, form and mind are distinguished and explained separately. This is because the aspects of the contaminated and so on are easily understood. Therefore, the elements are the basis for contemplation, not the aggregates and bases.

original: de'i phyir khams bco brgyad la gzugs can du zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir khams bco brgyad la gzugs can du zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚ÄúWhich of the eighteen elements are form?‚Äù

original: gzugs su yod pas gzugs te /üîΩ'di dag la yod pas gzugs can no //
analyzed: gzugs su yod pas gzugs te / 'di dag la yod pas gzugs can no //
translated: Form is that which can be broken or destroyed.üîΩThe eighteen elements that possess form are the ten physical elements and the eight that are included in the element of mental objects.

original: yang na rten dang brten pa'i gzugs ji ltar mthun mthun du 'di dag la yod pas gzugs can no //
analyzed: yang na rten dang brten pa'i gzugs ji ltar mthun mthun du 'di dag la yod pas gzugs can no //
translated: Alternatively, the ten physical elements and the eight that are included in the element of mental objects are called ‚Äúthose that possess form‚Äù because they are the basis for both the form that is the support and the form that is supported.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: The elements of visual consciousness, etc., are not subject to the same interpretation.

original: mig la sogs pa rten gyi dngos po de dag gi gzhi byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rten gyi dngos po de dag gi gzhi byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the eyes, etc., are not the basis for the form that is the support.

original: gang dag gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba de dag ni khams bcu ste /
analyzed: gang dag gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba de dag ni khams bcu ste /
translated: Those that are of the nature of the form heap are the ten elements that are included in the form heap.

original: mig gi khams nas lus kyi bar dang / gzugs kyi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi khams nas lus kyi bar dang / gzugs kyi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du'o //
translated: These are the ten elements that range from the eye element to the body element and from the form element to the tangible-object element.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gzugs su yod du zin kyang chos kyi khams gzugs can nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gzugs su yod du zin kyang chos kyi khams gzugs can nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even though nonindicative form does exist as form, it is not the case that the element of mental objects is form.

original: de la rten dang brten pa'i gzugs med pa dang / gzugs su yod pa med pa dang / gzugs @246a * //
analyzed: de la rten dang brten pa'i gzugs med pa dang / gzugs su yod pa med pa dang / gzugs @246a * //
translated: It is formless in that it has no form as a basis or something based on it.üîΩIt is formless in that it has no form as something existent or nonexistent.

original: kyi phung por gtogs su zin kyang gzugs su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi phung por gtogs su zin kyang gzugs su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The form of the formless realm is not form because it is not form that is a basis or that is supported, it is not form that exists as form, and it is not form that is included in the aggregate of form.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa du zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa du zhe na /
translated: How many are not form?

original: lhag ma rnams so zhes bya ba la gzugs can las ldog pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams so zhes bya ba la gzugs can las ldog pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa ste /
translated: The rest. The term ‚Äúnot form‚Äù is a negation of form.

original: de dag ni brgyad de /
analyzed: de dag ni brgyad de /
translated: There are eight of them:

original: sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams so //
translated: the seven mental constituents and the phenomena constituent.üîΩHow many are visible?

original: bstan du yod pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad kyi skabs yin pas der sbyar ro //
analyzed: bstan du yod pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad kyi skabs yin pas der sbyar ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúvisible‚Äù is to be supplied from the context of the eighteen constituents.

original: gzugs kyi khams gcig ste zhes bya ba la 'di ni 'di na'o zhes /üîΩpha bi ni pha bi na'o zhes bstan du rung ba de ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams gcig ste zhes bya ba la 'di ni 'di na'o zhes / pha bi ni pha bi na'o zhes bstan du rung ba de ni bstan pa'o //
translated: One constituent is visible.üîΩIt is suitable to indicate that ‚Äúthis is here‚Äù and ‚Äúthat is there.‚Äù

original: de dang lhan cig pa ni bstan du yod pa ste /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig pa ni bstan du yod pa ste /
translated: That which is visible is visible.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like ‚Äúhaving an object.‚Äù

original: bstan du yod pa 'di nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan du yod pa 'di nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that which is visible, the root text says:

original: yul bstan du yod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yul bstan du yod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is visible because it is visible in a certain place.

original: yul de dang der 'dis bstan du yod pas yul bstan du yod pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul de dang der 'dis bstan du yod pas yul bstan du yod pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: It is visible because it is visible in a certain place.

original: gzugs kyi khams gcig kho na bstan du yod pa nyid du smos pas lhag ma khams bcu bdun ni bstan du med par grub bo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams gcig kho na bstan du yod pa nyid du smos pas lhag ma khams bcu bdun ni bstan du med par grub bo //
translated: Only the form element is called visible because it is visible. The remaining seventeen elements are established as invisible.üîΩHow many are impeded?

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa du zhen zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad kyi skabs yin pas thams cad du yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa du zhen zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad kyi skabs yin pas thams cad du yang sbyar ro //
translated: The question is asked in terms of the eighteen elements, so the answer is given in terms of all of them.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir gzugs can smos so //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir gzugs can smos so //
translated: The word impeded is used because they are impeded by form.

original: chos kyi khams la yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs yod pas /
analyzed: chos kyi khams la yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs yod pas /
translated: The element of mental objects includes non-informative form.

original: gzugs can yod par bstan pa'i phyir bcu zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzugs can yod par bstan pa'i phyir bcu zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The word ten is used to show that there is form.

original: de dag kyang mig la sogs pa dbang po'i khams rnams dang / de dag gi yul gzugs can gyi khams lnga'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang mig la sogs pa dbang po'i khams rnams dang / de dag gi yul gzugs can gyi khams lnga'o //
translated: They are the ten elements of eye, etc., and the five elements of form, etc., which are the objects of those.

original: go gcod pas thogs pa ste /
analyzed: go gcod pas thogs pa ste /
translated: Impediment is obstruction.

original: de dang lhan cig pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: That which is together with obstruction is obstructive.

original: go gcod pa ni yul dang dmigs pa dang sgrib pas go gcod pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: go gcod pa ni yul dang dmigs pa dang sgrib pas go gcod pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Obstruction is threefold, according to the distinctions of spatial, objective, and obscuration obstructions.

original: 'dir ni sgrib pa'i go gcod pa nyid thogs pa dang bcas par 'dod pa bstan pa'i phyir gang la gang thogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'dir ni sgrib pa'i go gcod pa nyid thogs pa dang bcas par 'dod pa bstan pa'i phyir gang la gang thogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to show that here only the obstruction of obscuration is considered to be obstruction, he says: that which is obstructed by something in a certain place.

original: sgrib pa'i go gcod pa ni rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gegs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i go gcod pa ni rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gegs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The obstruction of obscuration is the hindrance to the arising of another in one‚Äôs own place.

original: de ltar na gang gis rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa dang / gang la gegs byed pa de @246b gnyi ga yang thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gang gis rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa dang / gang la gegs byed pa de @246b gnyi ga yang thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, both that which hinders the arising of another in its own place and that which is hindered are shown to be obstructive.

original: khams gzugs can bcu po de dag kyang rang rang gi yul du 'byung ba la gcig la gcig gegs byed pas sgrib cing go gcod pa'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: khams gzugs can bcu po de dag kyang rang rang gi yul du 'byung ba la gcig la gcig gegs byed pas sgrib cing go gcod pa'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: Those ten elements that have form are obstructive because they obstruct and hinder the arising of another in their own place.

original: lhag ma sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams ni thogs pa med par grub po zag pa dang bcas pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni khams kyi skabs yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams ni thogs pa med par grub po zag pa dang bcas pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni khams kyi skabs yin no //
translated: How many are impure?üîΩThe fifteen elements and the last three in part.

original: bco lnga dang tha ma gsum gyi cha ste zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga'i khams dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga'i khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga ste /
analyzed: bco lnga dang tha ma gsum gyi cha ste zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga'i khams dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga'i khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga ste /
translated: The five elements of the eye, etc., the five elements of form, etc., and the five elements of visual consciousness, etc.

original: khams bco lnga po dag ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: khams bco lnga po dag ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: These fifteen elements are exclusively impure.

original: dang po la yang gsum yod de /
analyzed: dang po la yang gsum yod de /
translated: The first element is also threefold.

original: mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams yin pas de'i phyir tha ma zhes smos so //
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams yin pas de'i phyir tha ma zhes smos so //
translated: The element of the eye, the element of form, and the element of visual consciousness.

original: tha ma gsum ni yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: tha ma gsum ni yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: The last three are the element of the mental faculty, the element of mental objects, and the element of mental consciousness.

original: de dag gi cha ni cha shas te /
analyzed: de dag gi cha ni cha shas te /
translated: Their part is a portion.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is impure.

original: mig la sogs pa bzhin du thams cad zag pa dang bcas pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhin du thams cad zag pa dang bcas pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not all contaminated like the eye, etc.

original: de dag las kyang lam gyi bden pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi rang bzhin gyi cha ma yin pa de nyid zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de dag las kyang lam gyi bden pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi rang bzhin gyi cha ma yin pa de nyid zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Moreover, only that part of the truth of the path and of the unconditioned which is not the pure part is contaminated.

original: zag pa dang lhan cig pas zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang lhan cig pas zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is contaminated because it is associated with the contaminants.

original: de'i phyir de dag nyon mongs pa skye ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag nyon mongs pa skye ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says: because the contaminants arise from them.

original: 'di ltar de dag las nyon mongs pa skye bas de'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag las nyon mongs pa skye bas de'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this way, the contaminants arise from them, and therefore they are called contaminated.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni /
translated: The consciousnesses of the eye, etc.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin pas ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnams la nyon mongs pa skyed ce na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin pas ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnams la nyon mongs pa skyed ce na /
translated: are non-conceptual, so how do the contaminants arise from them with regard to form, etc.?

original: nyon mongs pa rnams mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / lhan cig tu gzugs la sogs pa la 'byung ba zhes mi bya mod kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / lhan cig tu gzugs la sogs pa la 'byung ba zhes mi bya mod kyi /
translated: The contaminants do not arise with regard to form, etc., simultaneously with the eye consciousness, etc.

original: 'on kyang mngon sum gyi spyod yul gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pas nyon mongs la skyed pa ste /üîΩ'di ltar mig la brten cing gzugs la sogs pa la @247a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum gyi spyod yul gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pas nyon mongs la skyed pa ste / 'di ltar mig la brten cing gzugs la sogs pa la @247a * //
translated: However, because they are the domain of direct perception, they generate afflictions through form, etc.

original: brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form, etc.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas myong ba'i gzugs rnams la yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par rtog par byed pas rnam par rtog pa las nyon mongs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas myong ba'i gzugs rnams la yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par rtog par byed pas rnam par rtog pa las nyon mongs pa 'byung ste /
translated: The mental consciousness conceptualizes forms, etc. that are experienced by eye consciousness, and afflictions arise from conceptualization.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the remaining sense faculties.

original: zag pa med pa du zhe na /üîΩtha ma gsum gyi cha'o zhes bya ba ni yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa du zhe na / tha ma gsum gyi cha'o zhes bya ba ni yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams kyi'o //
translated: How many are uncontaminated?üîΩThe last three elements have a part that is uncontaminated.

original: lam gyi bden pa dang 'dus ma byas su gtogs pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa dang 'dus ma byas su gtogs pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The part of the mental element, mental consciousness element, and the phenomena element that is included in the truth of the path and unconditioned phenomena is uncontaminated.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad ces bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa du zhe na zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad ces bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe eighteen elements‚Äù is supplied.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga ni 'dod par bya ba yin pas 'dod pa rnams te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga ni 'dod par bya ba yin pas 'dod pa rnams te /
translated: The five objects such as form are called ‚Äúdesirable‚Äù because they are desired.

original: de gces su byed pa'i khams rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de gces su byed pa'i khams rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams su shes par bya'o //
translated: The elements that cherish those objects are called the desire realm.

original: yang na 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa du zhe na zhes brjod pa'i rigs pa las khams zhes bya ba'i sgra ma smos pa 'dod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa du zhe na zhes brjod pa'i rigs pa las khams zhes bya ba'i sgra ma smos pa 'dod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Alternatively, the phrase ‚Äúassociated with the desire realm‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúassociated with the desire realm element,‚Äù but the word element is omitted.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa dag ni 'dod pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa dag ni 'dod pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa rnams te /
translated: Those that are associated with the desire realm are included in the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they are the essence of the desire realm.

original: 'di ltar gang du 'dod pa'i sred pa kun du 'byung ba thams cad 'dod pa'i khams su bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang du 'dod pa'i sred pa kun du 'byung ba thams cad 'dod pa'i khams su bsdus pa'o //
translated: In this way, all the occurrences of craving for desire are included in the desire realm.

original: de dag kyang dbang po'i khams drug dang / yul gyi khams drug dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug go //
